subject: Cybersecurity
title: Cyber Insurance: Transferring Digital Risk
description: A micro-lesson that makes Cyber Insurance: Transferring Digital Risk usable.

hook.text: When a company gets hit by ransomware, cyber insurance pays the ransom, the recovery costs, and the lawsuits..

buildup.text: Cyber insurance covers breach response, business interruption, ransom payments, and legal costs. Premiums have.

discovery.text: Insurers now require MFA, endpoint detection, and backups before issuing policies. Insurance is driving.

twist.text: Mondelez's insurer refused to pay a $100M NotPetya claim, arguing it was an 'act of war' (a policy exclusion)..

climax.text: Cyber insurance creates a paradox: does paying ransoms encourage more attacks? Some argue insurance funds.

punchline.text: Insurance pays the ransom. Ransomware grows. Insurance costs more.

quiz.question: Why did Mondelez's cyber insurance claim for NotPetya get denied?
options: The insurer classified NotPetya as an 'act of war,' which was excluded from coverage
Mondelez didn't report the breach in time
